definition: mirror (as a metaphor for sth beautiful, bright and flat -- such as a lake -- or sth that provides clarity and insight)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Emotional when the mirror will be almost blurted out the true identity of the Ming house.
sentences.chinese: 情绪激动之时，明镜险些将明楼的真实身份脱口而出。

sentences.english: Rinpoche also stressed the importance of carrying the mirror-mind into the dream and deep sleep states.
sentences.chinese: 仁波切地强调梦境与深睡状态中的明镜之心。

sentences.english: Then call minglou, said mirror in her hand.
sentences.chinese: 然后打电话给明楼，说明镜就在她手上。

sentences.english: Our body be a bodhi tree, Our mind be a mirror bright, Clean and polish frequently, Let no dust alight.
sentences.chinese: 身是菩提树，心如明镜台，时时勤拂拭，勿使惹尘埃。

sentences.english: The final Ming Tai or only admitted everything counts, let a 'mirror.
sentences.chinese: 最终明台还是只能承认了一切罪状，让明镜一时气结。

sentences.english: But you are eternity and your are the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 但你们就是永恒，你们也是明镜。

sentences.english: We all have a clear idea that AIDS is fatal, and there is no cure at all.
sentences.chinese: 我们都心如明镜，艾滋是致命的，无药可治。
君不见高堂明镜悲白发。

sentences.english: Several women can do inside the glassy transparent?
sentences.chinese: 有几个女子能够做到内心如明镜般通透？

sentences.english: Each one faces south to see the northern dipper.
sentences.chinese: 明镜当台列像殊，一一面南看北斗。

sentences.english: Chen Mingjing, a flamboyant Sichuanese entrepreneur who conceived of and funded the park, said he had always wanted to contribute to society.
sentences.chinese: 陈明镜，一名显赫的四川商人构思并创办了这个公园。

sentences.english: The Erhai Lake looks like a mirror dotted with floating boats on its rippling surface.
sentences.chinese: 洱海像一面明镜，小船在泛着涟漪的湖面上飘荡。

sentences.english: Didnt expect Liu Zhongxin such as mirror, suddenly see through her trick.
sentences.chinese: 没想到刘忠心如明镜，一下子就看穿了她的小把戏。

definition: limpid autumn waters (trad. description of girl's beautiful eyes)
bright moon/refers to 夜明珠, a legendary pearl that can glow in the dark/CL:輪|轮[lun2]
white lotus (flower)/White Lotus society/same as 白蓮教|白莲教
The Goddess, 1934 silent film about a Shanghai prostitute, directed by 吳永剛|吴永刚[Wu2 Yong3 gang1]
"heavenly lake", lake situated on a mountain/used as the name of numerous lakes, such as 長白山天池|长白山天池[Chang2 bai2 shan1 Tian1 chi2]
gleaming reflection of waves in sunlight
the hidden and the visible/that which can be seen and that which cannot/darkness and light/night and day/wisdom and ignorance/evil and good/the living and the dead/men and ghosts
